description: Integrate your applications with the Pylon API to manage users, contacts, issues, and knowledge base articles seamlessly. Access and manipulate Pylon data through a comprehensive set of tools designed for efficient workflow automation. Enhance your productivity by leveraging this server to interact with Pylon's platform programmatically.

pylonApiToken.description: The API key for the Pylon MCP server.

capabilities.name: pylon_get_me
capabilities.description: Get current user information from Pylon. Returns your user profile including name, email, role, and permissions. Use this to verify your authentication and see what access level you have.

capabilities.name: pylon_get_contacts
capabilities.description: Get customer contacts from Pylon. Use this to find customers who have submitted support tickets or inquiries. Returns contact details like name, email, company, and contact history.

capabilities.name: pylon_create_contact
capabilities.description: Create a new customer contact in Pylon. Use this when adding a new customer who will submit support requests or access your customer portal.

capabilities.name: pylon_get_issues
capabilities.description: Get support issues/tickets from Pylon. Returns a list of customer support requests with details like title, status, priority, and assigned team member. Use this to see your workload or find specific issues.

capabilities.name: pylon_create_issue
capabilities.description: Create a new support issue/ticket in Pylon. Use this to log customer problems, bug reports, or feature requests that need to be tracked and resolved.

capabilities.name: pylon_get_knowledge_bases
capabilities.description: Get all knowledge bases from Pylon. Knowledge bases contain help articles, FAQs, and documentation that customers can access. Returns list of available knowledge bases with their names and article counts.

capabilities.name: pylon_get_knowledge_base_articles
capabilities.description: Get help articles from a specific knowledge base. Use this to find existing documentation that might help resolve customer issues or to see what self-service content is available.

capabilities.name: pylon_create_knowledge_base_article
capabilities.description: Create a new help article in a knowledge base. Use this to add new documentation, FAQs, or troubleshooting guides that customers can access for self-service support.

capabilities.name: pylon_get_teams
capabilities.description: Get all support teams from Pylon. Teams are groups of support agents that handle different types of issues (e.g., Technical, Billing, Sales). Returns team names, member counts, and specializations.

capabilities.name: pylon_get_team
capabilities.description: Get detailed information about a specific support team. Returns team members, their roles, current workload, and team performance metrics.

capabilities.name: pylon_create_team
capabilities.description: Create a new support team in Pylon. Use this to organize support agents into specialized groups for handling different types of customer issues (e.g., Technical Support, Billing, Enterprise accounts).

capabilities.name: pylon_get_accounts
capabilities.description: Get all customer accounts from Pylon. Accounts represent companies or organizations that use your service. Returns account details like company name, subscription level, and contact information.

capabilities.name: pylon_get_account
capabilities.description: Get detailed information about a specific customer account. Returns company details, subscription info, billing status, and associated contacts and issues.

capabilities.name: pylon_search_users
capabilities.description: Search for team members and support agents in Pylon. Use this to find colleagues by name, email, or department when assigning issues or checking availability.

capabilities.name: pylon_get_users
capabilities.description: Get all team members and support agents in your Pylon workspace. Returns user profiles including names, roles, teams, and availability status.

capabilities.name: pylon_search_contacts
capabilities.description: Search for customer contacts in Pylon by name, email, company, or other details. Use this to quickly find a specific customer when you need to view their information or create an issue for them.

capabilities.name: pylon_search_issues
capabilities.description: Search for support issues/tickets in Pylon by keywords, customer name, or issue content. Use this to find related issues, check for duplicates, or research similar problems.

capabilities.name: pylon_get_issue
capabilities.description: Get complete details of a specific support issue/ticket. Returns full issue information including title, description, status, priority, assignee, customer info, and conversation history.

capabilities.name: pylon_update_issue
capabilities.description: Update an existing support issue/ticket. Use this to change status (e.g., mark as resolved), reassign to different team members, update priority, or modify details as you work on the issue.

capabilities.name: pylon_snooze_issue
capabilities.description: Temporarily hide an issue until a future date/time. Use this for issues that cannot be worked on now but need follow-up later (e.g., waiting for customer response, scheduled maintenance, feature release).

capabilities.name: pylon_get_issue_messages
capabilities.description: Get the conversation history for a specific support issue. Returns all messages between customer and support team, including timestamps and sender information. Use this to understand the context and progress of an issue.

capabilities.name: pylon_create_issue_message
capabilities.description: Add a new message/reply to a support issue conversation. Use this to respond to customers, add internal notes, or provide updates on issue progress.

capabilities.name: pylon_get_tags
capabilities.description: Get all available tags for categorizing issues and contacts. Tags help organize and filter support tickets by topic, urgency, or type (e.g., "bug", "feature-request", "billing", "urgent").

capabilities.name: pylon_create_tag
capabilities.description: Create a new tag for categorizing issues and contacts. Use this to add new categories that help organize and filter your support tickets effectively.

capabilities.name: pylon_get_ticket_forms
capabilities.description: Get all ticket submission forms available to customers. Forms define what information customers provide when creating new support requests (e.g., bug report form, billing inquiry form).

capabilities.name: pylon_create_ticket_form
capabilities.description: Create a new ticket submission form for customers. Use this to customize what information customers provide when creating different types of support requests (bug reports, feature requests, billing questions).

capabilities.name: pylon_get_webhooks
capabilities.description: Get all configured webhooks in Pylon. Webhooks automatically send notifications to external systems when events occur (e.g., new issues created, status changes, messages added).

capabilities.name: pylon_create_webhook
capabilities.description: Create a new webhook to automatically notify external systems when events occur in Pylon. Use this to integrate with Slack, Discord, email systems, or custom applications.

capabilities.name: pylon_delete_webhook
capabilities.description: Delete an existing webhook to stop sending notifications to an external system. Use this when removing integrations or cleaning up unused webhooks.
